intro: Pentanema ensifolium, commonly known as the swordleaf pentanema, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, sword-like leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. Its flowers are small and clustered, often producing a fragrant scent that attracts pollinators. Pentanema ensifolium is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
